*Component items*:
  * *Eye* (*TARGET.TSA.EYE*)
   * *Eye sensory data* (*eye-sensory*): after on-center/off-center edge extraction and zipping 100:1
   * *Eye sensory data* (*eye-sensory*): eye -> semilunar ganglion/ophthalmic -> PTR
   * *Eye sensory data* (*eye-sensory*): eye -> semilunar ganglion/ophthalmic -> STR, proprioception
  * *Eye* (*TARGET.TSA.EYE*)
   * *Eye rotation motor muscles* (*eye-rotation-motor*): extorsion, elevation, abduction
   * *Eye rotation motor muscles* (*eye-rotation-motor*): depression and adduction
   * *Eye rotation motor muscles* (*eye-rotation-motor*): adducts the eyeball
   * *Eye rotation motor muscles* (*eye-rotation-motor*): elevates, adducts, and rotates medially the eye
   * *Eye rotation motor muscles* (*eye-rotation-motor*): retracts/elevates eyelid
   * *Eye rotation motor muscles* (*eye-rotation-motor*): superior oblique, rotation in a vertical plane - looking down and up, rotation in the plane of the face
   * *Eye rotation motor muscles* (*eye-rotation-motor*): lateral rectus, quick turn to the right -> compensatory reflex turning of two eyes to the left
  * *Eye* (*TARGET.TSA.EYE*)
   * *Eye pupil and accomodation motor muscles* (*eye-pupil-motor*): to ciliary muscle to increase eye accomodation
   * *Eye pupil and accomodation motor muscles* (*eye-pupil-motor*): to ciliary muscle to inhibit eye accomodation
   * *Eye pupil and accomodation motor muscles* (*eye-pupil-motor*): to sphincter pupillae to close pupil
   * *Eye pupil and accomodation motor muscles* (*eye-pupil-motor*): to dilator pupillae to open pupil
  * *Eye* (*TARGET.TSA.EYE*)
   * *Eyelid motor muscles* (*eyelid-motor*): orbital portion, contraction of the orbital to reduce glare
   * *Eyelid motor muscles* (*eyelid-motor*): lacrimal part (tensor tarsi), conscious muscle to close eye; draws the eyelids and the ends of the lacrimal canals medialward and compresses them against the surface of the globe of the eye; compresses the lacrimal sac
   * *Eyelid motor muscles* (*eyelid-motor*): palpebral portion, acts involuntarily, closing the lids gently; involuntary muscle to close eye
   * *Eyelid motor muscles* (*eyelid-motor*): raise the upper eyelid
   * *Eyelid motor muscles* (*eyelid-motor*): lower lid retraction
   * *Eyelid motor muscles* (*eyelid-motor*): protrusion of eyeball
  * *Eye* (*TARGET.TSA.EYE*)
   * *Eye glands* (*eye-glands*): tears
   * *Eye glands* (*eye-glands*): tears
